Handling a Veteran’s Spouse’s Income for Section 306 Pension
Consider the questions in the table below when determining how to handle a Veteran’s spouse’s income for Section 306 Pension.
If the ...
Then ...
spouse does not live with the Veteran
exclude the spouse’s income.
spouse’s income is not available to the Veteran
exclude the spouse’s income.
spouse’s income is used to pay expenses beyond the ordinary and usual family requirements
exclude the income on the grounds that to count it would cause the Veteran hardship.
spouse has countable retirement/annuity income
reduce the income by 10 percent.
spouse has earned income that exceeds the spouse income exclusion from the
protected pensions rate tables
.
exclude all earned income of the spouse.
spouse income exclusion from the
protected pensions rate tables
exceeds the spouse’s earned income
exclude the spouse income exclusion amount.
Note
:  When you have arrived at the spouse’s countable income, add it to the Veteran’s basic countable income.  Deductible expenses to arrive at IVAP can further reduce this amount.
